headline: Property tax winners and losers
desc: Oregon homeowners used to pay taxes based on what their property was worth. That connection ended in 1997 when voters limited how much property values could grow each year for tax purposes. Homeowners in slow-growth neighborhoods now routinely pay higher taxes than people with homes of greater value in gentrified areas. We wondered: What would happen if the tax benefits of 1997’s Measure 50 were redistributed based on market value?

headline: Oregon school vaccination rates
desc: Here are vaccination rates for more than 3,200 schools and child-care facilities in Oregon for the 2017-18 school year. The rate is determined by the number of students who have received all required vaccinations for their age or grade level.

headline: Portland bike thefts
desc: The number of bike thefts reported to Portland police has doubled over the past eight years. The geographical spread of those thefts, however, has stayed fairly constant. Data provided by police includes bikes reported stolen during car thefts and car prowls. Still, areas where bikes are most likely to be parked outside — universities, high schools and shopping centers — explain most of the city’s hot spots.

headline: Real-time earthquake map
desc: A map of every earthquake recorded over the last 30 days by the USGS. Updated every 15 minutes

headline: Portland's dog names
desc: Curious about what Portlanders name their dogs? We were, too. So here they are, from every Labrador retriever named Lucy (374) to every Australian Shepherd named Dallas Nana Nana Boo Boo Hickenlooper-clift (1). So spend some time here. Poke around. You’ll be surprised and amused by your neighbors’ endless creativity. And to the person out there in 97208 with the bulldog named Rupert Murdog? Well played, sir or madam. Well played.
